title: Using Box<T> for Heap Data
description: In this lab, we will learn about using Box<T> smart pointers to store data on the heap, rather than the stack, in situations where the size of the type is unknown at compile time, when transferring ownership of large amounts of data to avoid copying, or when owning a value that implements a particular trait.

meta.title: Using Box
meta.t: smart pointers to store data on the heap in Rust programming.
meta.keywords: box, rust playground, smart pointers, rust tutor, rust online compiler, heap, rust commands, rust practice, rust online, rust online playground
